Class PuzzleNode

    • PuzzleNode

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • PuzzleNode

        public PuzzleNode(int[][] entState,
          PuzzleNode entParent,
          int entRandomSteps)
        PuzzleNode constructor to create a new PuzzleNode from a specified state, and with a specified parent
        Parameters:
        entState - - int[][] which will be the starting state of the new puzzle
        entParent - - the parent of this puzzleNode. When using this constructor, use the value null for this parameter (unless you want to test specifying the parent). This parameter is not null for the solving methods, as well in the child puzzleNodes which stem from a given puzzleNode.
        entRandomSteps - - number of random steps to do on the entered state/puzzle

      • PuzzleNode

        public PuzzleNode(int entPuzzleSize,
          int entRandomSteps)
        PuzzleNode constructor to create a default PuzzleNode with a given size, and with specified amount of random steps. The default puzzle is the goal state for that grid. EX for a 3x3: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 If entPuzzleSize is not (PerfectSquare - 1), it will form a grid of the next fitting size. So, grid configs will be 2x2, 3x3, 4x4 etc. "8" will create an 8 puzzle with grid size 3x3. "9" will create a 4x4 grid.
        Parameters:
        entPuzzleSize - - an int to determing the grid size. See explanation above.
        entRandomSteps - - number of random movements of the blank on the default puzzle.

    • Method Detail

      • findAndUpdateBlankPosition

        public void findAndUpdateBlankPosition()
        Finds the blank space (represented by an "0"), and updates the location instances with this position. Program will terminate if the entered grid has no blanks

      • arrayClone

        public int[][] arrayClone(int[][] entArr)
        This method creates a cloned version of the array passed in as a param.
        Parameters:
        entArr - - the array to clone
        Returns:
        - a copy of the entered array

      • printPuzzleState

        public void printPuzzleState()
        Prints the current state/config of the puzzle to the console. Prints "|" between numbers for clarity

      • populateDefaultState

        public void populateDefaultState()
        Fills the puzzleState array with the default puzzle values, which is the goal state. For a 3x3, default state is: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8

      • getGoalState

        public int[][] getGoalState()
        Gets the goal state for the puzzle of this size.
        Returns:
        goal state for this size puzzle in int[][] form

      • getMovableBlankPositions

        public boolean[] getMovableBlankPositions()
        Used to find the positions where the blank can move to. The possivblePos boolean array contains 4 indicies. 0 represents left, 1 represents right, 2 represents up, 3 represents down. A true value means the the blank can move in this direction, and false means the blank cannot move in that direction
        Returns:
        an array of positions where the blank can move

      • moveBlank

        public boolean moveBlank(int whichDirectionToMove)
        Method to move the blank, and swap it with the number in the position it is moving to. Position to move to is an integer, where 0 = left, 1 = right, 2 = up, 3 = down Calls the getMovableBlankPositions() method to see if the entered position can be moved to. Also saves the direction the blank was moved.
        Parameters:
        whichDirectionToMove - where 0 = left, 1 = right, 2 = up, 3 = down
        Returns:
        a boolean that says if the move was successful

      • randomize

        public void randomize(int entRandomSteps)
        Randomizes the puzzle. This method moves the blank to random positions a given amount of times
        Parameters:
        entRandomSteps - - the amount of times to move the blank

      • generateChildren

        public void generateChildren()
        This method will find all the positions where the blank can move to, and will create a new puzzleNode for each movement. It will not randomize the new puzzleNode, and will set its parent to the calling PuzzleNode. The new puzzleNodes will be stored in an arrayList of puzzleNodes

      • getPuzzleStateArray

        public int[][] getPuzzleStateArray()
        Returns:
        the int[][] puzzleState array. The puzzle in int[][] form.

      • printPathToGoal

        public void printPathToGoal()
        Prints the path to the final state of the puzzle, from the pre-solved state. It will show the puzzle at each step, as well as the movement done at each step. Uses a stack for efficiency and convenience.

      • setPuzzleNodeVisited

        public void setPuzzleNodeVisited()
        Sets the visited instance to true, use for BFS and DFS

      • isVisited

        public boolean isVisited()
        Returns:
        - visited, whether or not this node has been visited already

      • getPuzzleStateAsString

        public java.lang.String getPuzzleStateAsString()
        Uses a stringbuilder to convert the puzzleboard into a string. Appends the numbers in the board from left to right, top to bottom.
        Returns:
        the puzzle board in string form. Used with a hash table in BFS and DFS
